Preference.android:title: Most settings are now per-app
Preference.android:summary: This menu is now left with only several global settings. Most other settings were moved to per-app settings which means you can set different options for every app. You can get to them by clicking on app name in app list (where you check/uncheck apps) or you can edit default settings, which you can find at the top of the app list.

CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Disable new notifications popping up. You can still see them by launching app manually and opening Active or History. Syncs with "Notifications ON/OFF" switch on Pebble
CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Disable popup entirely

CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: When unchecked, Notification Center will still collect notifications and send them after Pebble reconnects.
CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Disable notify when Pebble is disconnected

CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Disable new notifications popping up when phone is in vibrate or in silent mode
CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Disable notify when in silent mode

CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Do not send notifications when Quiet Time is enabled on the watch
CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Respect watch's Quiet Time

CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: When pebble reconnects to the phone, immediately display all missed notifications. Only works on watchapp notifications.
CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Display notifications after reconnect

CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: One-click toggle to completely enable/disable vibration. Syncs with "Vibration ON/OFF" switch on Pebble.
CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Disable vibration entirely

EditTextPreference.android:summary: After this amount of seconds being idle, watchapp will close automaticaly. You can press any button on watch to stop this timer. Enter 0 to disable.
EditTextPreference.android:title: Auto-Close timeout

EditTextPreference.android:summary: After this amount of seconds being idle, watchapp will stop vibrating periodically. Enter 0 to vibrate indefinitely. Has no effect if periodic vibration is turned off (in per-app settings).
EditTextPreference.android:title: Periodic vibration timeout

CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: You need to ENABLE DEVELOPER CONNECTION to get this to work (please read instructions in the FAQ on how to do this). It is also a bit buggy (sometimes app won't close), use on your own risk.
CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Close to previously running app

ListPreference.android:title: Light screen on notification
ListPreference.android:summary: Turn on display light when notification arrives

EditTextPreference.android:summary: If above setting is on, light will be on for this amount of seconds
EditTextPreference.android:title: Light timeout

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: White notification text
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Display white notification text with black background

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Skew background image colors
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Skew colors of the notification image when it is displayed in background behind text. This will make an image in background a bit less washed out, but will make the colors a bit skewed.

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Show actions menu instantly
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: When this is checked, blank actions menu will be displayed instantly after pressing the button with text delayed. This allows you to pick action even before text arrives from phone if you know where it is (for example if you know dismiss is first option, you can just quickly double tap). When unchecked, menu will appear when text arrives.

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Display scroll shadow
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: When this is checked, Pebble will display scroll shadow to indicate whether there is more content to scroll on the top/bottom.

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Scroll page-by-page
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Scroll page by page instead of line by line. This option is always enabled regardless of the setting on round devices. If you use that feature, it is recommended to turn the scroll shadow off because it can cover text at the beginning of the page. If your Pebble is running SDK 2, this option might cause text to be cut off in between pages.

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Display disconnected notification
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: If bluetooth is disconnected while NC is open, display disconnected notification

Preference.android:summary: Here you can define vibration pattern for periodic vibration. Pattern is in format \'vibrateTime, pauseTime, vibrateTime, pauseTime ...\', where times are in miliseconds. For example \'100, 200, 300\' will vibrate for 100ms, then wait 200 ms and then again vibrate for 300ms. Limit is 20 total numbers (so 10 vibrations and 10 pauses). Maximum total duration is 10 seconds.
Preference.android:title: Periodic vibration pattern

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Enable scrolling gestures
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Enable button-free scrolling through the notifications by just twisting the hand. \n\nPlease keep in mind that this feature is experimental and very finicky. It may cause increased battery drain when notification is displayed for prolonged amounts of time or even dismiss notifications by itself if it falsely detects a gesture.

Preference.android:title: Scrolling gestures demo
Preference.android:summary: Tap on this text to see the demonstration of the scrolling gestures.

CheckBoxPreference.android:title: Enable debug logging
CheckBoxPreference.android:summary: Enable logging to PebbleNotificationCenter\\log.txt. Use when debugging.
